prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would. You have a whole pizza in the refrigerator. On your first trip to the refrigerator, you eat half the pizza. On each successive trip, you eat half of the remaining pizza. After five trips to the refrigerator, what fractional part of the pizza have you eaten?
gpt_response: Yummy pizza! If we start with a whole pizza, and eat half of it on the first trip, we have 1/2 left. Then we eat half of that on the second trip, which leaves us with 1/4. On the third trip, we eat half of 1/4, leaving us with 1/8. After the fourth trip, we eat half of 1/8, which leaves us with 1/16. Finally, on the fifth trip, we eat half of 1/16, leaving us with 1/32. So after five trips, we have eaten 1/2 + 1/4 + 1/8 + 1/16 + 1/32 of the pizza!
solution_prompt: Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following equal to \frac{31?: Yummy pizza! If we start with a whole pizza, and eat half of it on the first trip, we have 1/2 left. Then we eat half of that on the second trip, which leaves us with 1/4. On the third trip, we eat half of 1/4, leaving us with 1/8. After the fourth trip, we eat half of 1/8, which leaves us with 1/16. Finally, on the fifth trip, we eat half of 1/16, leaving us with 1/32. So after five trips, we have eaten 1/2 + 1/4 + 1/8 + 1/16 + 1/32 of the pizza!
